column4: I’m continuing to share updates regarding the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and some resources that you may find helpful. https://t.co/rqSKpL9HoC

Today, I joined @RepBobbyRush in calling on the @EPA to secure equal rights to clean air protections. Air pollution has not only contributed to the climate crisis, but is linked to the increased mortality of COVID-19 in our most vulnerable communities.

Please join members of my staff and regional experts for a Small Business COVID-19 Webinar to learn about small business relief and assistance in Georgia's 5th Congressional District on Wednesday, April 22 at 5pm. https://t.co/eHx8QeqtNS

As the coronavirus outbreak continues, I am sharing some resources that may be helpful to you and your family regarding –

Travel Alerts 
School Meals in Metro Atlanta
Distance Learning Resources
Managing Student Debt; and 
Staying Calm and Centered

https://t.co/vU5i4YrkEn

Please be advised, the U.S. Department of State has issued an updated Level 4 Do Not Travel Global Health Advisory and is urging that all Americans who want to return to the United States should seek to do so immediately.
https://t.co/zK0aEWDiBM

As a community, we can beat this pandemic. It is very important that everyone remains healthy, calm, and positive by following guidance and safety precautions from the health professionals and local authorities. https://t.co/g3N76KPlre
RT @IDSAInfo: A new loan repayment bill introduced by @repjohnlewis today will boost the # of #HIV healthcare workers in the US, ensuring t…

75% of Fulton County’s new #HIV diagnoses are African Americans. On #NBHAAD, I introduced the HELP Act for loan repayment relief for HIV clinicians and dentists. We need more clinicians to End the Epidemic. #HELPHIVWorkforce #EHE
RT @WaysMeansCmte: House Democrats have passed OVER 400 pieces of legislation to protect retirees, bring down the cost of healthcare, grow…

I believe in my heart of hearts that quality, affordable health care is a right.

Health care should not depend on the size of your wallet or the digits in your zip code.  
https://t.co/1m3v9U4bmc
I hate to go down this road, but this discussion, this debate, is making me sick. It’s taking me back to another time and another place. It has the stench of racism. https://t.co/A5XSqumce8

I was more than pleased and delighted to visit the @CDCgov  headquarters in Atlanta with my staff. The CDC is doing important work, saving lives, and helping make America a healthier place for us all. #goodtrouble https://t.co/BqF4tpii9D

Health care is a fundamental human right that this country has yet to realize. 

As long as I live, I will fight with every ounce of strength, every breath in my body, to make this right a reality. https://t.co/hDNC4vytim
Don’t put it off any longer.  Open enrollment ends today.  Sign up for affordable health coverage at https://t.co/Iz6RKN6u0x now.
The deadline to sign up for 2019 health coverage is December 15! Go to https://t.co/Iz6RKN6u0x and #GetCovered today. https://t.co/ZL7E3xSSFO

I am sick and outraged over the murder of journalist and American permanent resident Jamal Khashoggi. The President and his administration have failed to uphold their duty to the Constitution and to the rule of law by turning a blind-eye to this demonic act.

We are sick and tired of seeing little babies taken from their mothers. That's not right, it's not fair, and history will not be kind to us. As a nation and as a people we can do much better. We may have to turn America upside down to turn it right-side up. #KeepFamiliesTogether
Working and middle class families, the sick, the elderly, and generations yet unborn will bear the burden of this reckless act.

You cannot hide the truth from the sick, the elderly, the disabled for whom this bill may mean life or death. All taxpayers expect, demand, and deserve better – much better -- than legislation, which puts politics before the good of the people. https://t.co/uCwQKXq5DM
How can you target the sick, the elderly, and the disabled?
If this were a fire, we would bring water. If this were a virus, we would send medicine. If this were a storm, we would give shelter.
The Republican healthcare plan is a shame and a disgrace. It must be stopped. https://t.co/twV0suVQyJ
Those who are sick will suffer, and some of them will die. This is a shame and a disgrace. May God have mercy on us all.
The House Republican bill, H.R. 1628, does not rescue health care. It is an attack on the poor, the sick, the elderly, and the disabled.
I will fight every single attempt to turn a deaf ear, a blind eye, and a cold shoulder to the sick, to our seniors, and to working families.
My skull fractured, I spent 3 days in Good Samaritan Hospital, the same hospital where Jimmie Lee Jackson had died. #Selma52 https://t.co/TjsvVSr244
Alabama State Troopers putting on their gas masks. #Selma52 https://t.co/tpBjMl3Sit
Affordable health care is the birthright of every American. At stake are not just the details of policy but the character of our country.
Half of people living w/HIV in Georgia are not consistently in care. It’s time to #GetTreated to stay healthy. https://t.co/9zNWHmkYmi
1 in 51 Georgians will contract HIV says @CDCgov. We must change that. #GetTested #GetTreated #EndAIDS https://t.co/7gVIAO9fgS
African Americans are hardest hit by HIV, especially in the South. We must end health disparities & stigma to end AIDS in America.
We must come together as brothers and sisters to fight the epidemic of HIV/AIDS in our communities. https://t.co/1Ymcz9TzFq
The HIV/AIDS epidemic is still with us. Every day too many people lose their lives to this disease. We must make a way out of noway.
Down below, we saw a sea of blue... Alabama State Troopers putting on their gas masks. #Selma51 https://t.co/mOSfX07atn
The American public -- and people around the world -- are sick and tired of war and violence. We don't need more bombs, missiles, and guns.
There are just too many guns available in this country that get into the hands of sick people, angry people, and irresponsible people.
Proud my legislation was signed into law. It's important that employer sponsored healthcare works for everyone. http://t.co/rxnwfXQlGz
My skull fractured, I spent 3 days in Good Samaritan, the same hospital where Jimmie Lee Jackson had died #Selma50 http://t.co/W1lL4wepV6
The Major paused for a minute and then he said, "Troopers advance!" And you saw these men putting on their gas masks. http://t.co/NDAkngX9kE
55 years ago today, I was arrested for the first time for protesting segregated lunch counters in downtown Nashville. http://t.co/qxkB6B81Gb

It was 49 yrs ago today that President Johnson signed #Medicare & #Medicaid into law, guaranteeing health coverage for millions of Americans
